dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chinese GONG SOUNDS and the glittering doors of an art poda slide open to reveal a mammoth silver stairway down rows of beautiful women start descending   (BEGIN MAIN TI The lovely ladies are a mix of races and they sing a stra haunting melody -- one might think them a heavenly choir, weren't for their sexy, clinging lame gowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the ethereal beauties, we cut to a street urchin's d face: SHORT ROUND is a ten-year-old Chinese kis wearing a up American baseball cap. Sneaking into the club, Short Round weaves past the fancy and silk suits, heading toward the music in the main ball

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round enters and stares across the smoky nightclub. stage, he sees a giant paper-mache dragon laying curled a the pagoda. Now, the dragon's eyes light up, its nostrils exhale smok its enormous jaws open.  Out of the dragon's mouth walks of the stage show: WILLIE SCOTT, a dreamy beauty singing a sultry solo white chestra wails the accompaniment. But Short Round's not here to ogle crooning dames.  He su the rich Chinese, American and European revelers.  Jewels and champagne flows.  Short Round finally spots a table o somber-looking Chinese men in suits. Short Round chews gum and stares at the men.  Then he tur go.  WU HAN, a waiter with a scar across his cheek, watch Round leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Short Round hurries toward the exit, he bumps into a m tuxedo entering the club.  Short Round looks up at the ma we don't see his face. Then Short Round is grabbed by the scruff of his neck and man hustles him out the door, Short Round yelling insults way. A maitre d' apologizes to the man in the tuxedo and two h girls smile at him familiarly as he continues into the ba We notice something incongruous:  the man in the tuxedo i ing work boots caked with mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the tuxedo stops to watch Willie Scott singing on the stage.  Then he looks around and sees the table of Chinese men that Short Round spotted earlier. As the man in the tuxedo walks toward the table, he remov cigarette from a silver case.  He arrives at the table ju the chorus and orchestra reach a crescendo -- And on the stage, a glistening, muscular slave swings a h mer toward an enormous brass gong -- The man in the tuxedo leans to receive a light from a cig girl and, as the GONG BOOMS, the match flares to reveal h for the first time: It's INDIANA JONES.  Elegant in a tuxedo -- dressed to ki TITLES END and over this a legend appears on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table, the four Chinese man in suits stare coldly ana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao She.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nee chin lie how ma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao's men laugh and assume that Indy doesn't understand h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wah hung how, nee nah?  Wah hwey hung jing chee jah loo nee kao soo wah shu shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAO SHE looks angry and his men's smiles fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never told me you spoke my language, Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to show off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana takes a seat across the table from Shanghai's not crime-lord.  Lao is fifty, wealthy enough to now display fat, but still muscular from his fight to the top of the heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this special occasion, I ordered champagne and caviar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana looks at the pile of caviar on the plate in front -- and stubs his cigarette out in it.  The cigarette sizz Lao's smiles dies with it. There's applause as Wille Scott finishes her song.  At th table, Lao stares at Indiana with a strange intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it is true, Dr. Jones?  you found Nurhachi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I found him.  Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana looks across the table at Lao's son, CHEN, who re a bulldog and snarls like one now. INDIANA (Cont'd) It was dark, but I think one of your sons tried to get Nurhachi without paying for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stares pointedly at Chen's recently bandaged hand. mutters and stands angrily -- Lao barks a command in Chin Chen sits down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have insulted my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones -- I want Nurhachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao pulls a wad of cash out of his pocket and puts it on table.  Indiana glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I recall the deal was consid- erably more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a pretty hand slips onto Lao's shoulder and he looks see Willie Scott.  Lao kisses her hand.  Willie is unawar explosive mood at the table and she smiles flirtaciously ana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lao) Aren't you going to introduce us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Willie Scott. (watching Indy) And this is Indiana Jones, the famous archaeologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie sits down between Lao and Indy.  She takes out a s mirror to check her make-up. LAO (Cont'd) Dr. Jones found Nurhachi for me and is about to deliver him -- now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao nods across the table and Indy sees KAO KAN, Lao's se son, open his coat and remove a silver-plated pistol.  In looks worried.  Willie doesn't notice as she fixes her ma and coyly teases Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I thought archaeologists were always funny little men searching for their mummies -- (yelping) Aaahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down terrified at the knife Indy is poking agai ribs. WILLE (Cont'd) I was only kidding, can't you take a joke -- ? (to Lao) Lao, he's got a knife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the gun away, sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kao Kan glances at his father.  Lao finally nods to his s he slips the pistol back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I suggest you pay me what you promised -- or your girlfriend here is going to be squealing a new tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ritzy patrons at the tables nearby are unaware of the drama quietly unfolding at this table. Willie eyes the blade and whimpers.  She looks imploringl and he slowly reaches into his pocket.  He puts ten gold next to the cash on the table. Indy leans forward to look at the gold coins -- so intent he fails to notice Kao Kan spilling some powder into Indy pagne glass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again Lao -- the deal was more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife pokes Willie and she whimpers again.  Lao reach another pocket and brings out a folded piece of rice pape opens it and a large diamond and ruby spill out onto the INDIANA (Cont'd) Bingo...you see, Lao, with a but of persuasion, even you can be an honest fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy smiles and jabs the knife into the middle of the tab Then he lifts his champagne glass in a toast to Lao -- wh watches expectantly as Indiana moves the glass toward his Suddenly Willie stands angrily, jostling Indy's arm so th doesn't drink his champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this!  He put a hole in my dress from Paris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao sees Indy put his champagne glass down and he snarls lie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie quickly obeys.  Lao forces a smile at Indy and lif glass to seal the deal -- LAO (Cont'd) To your health, Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao sips hs champagne and watches hopefully as Indy picks glass and this time Indy does drink the champagne. Then h reaches for the cash -- But Chen grins and puts a silver snuff bottle next to the gold and jewels -- he tips the little bottle over and som powder spills out of it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bonus, Dr. Jones.  That is poison.  You just drank the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana examines his champagne glass and sees a residue a bottom of it.  He swallows and feels sick, wondering it i or the poison already taking effect. LAO (Cont'd) There is an antidote for this poison.  You give me Nurhachi -- I give you the antidote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana is sweating.  Willie looks at him and sees Indy's shaking. LAO (Cont'd) The poison works fast, Dr. Jones. Where is Nurhachi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana finally reaches into his pocket.  Next to the cas jewels and poison, Indiana sets down a beautiful small bo and his men stare hypnotically at the exquisite gold and box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) This Nurhachi's a very small guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody pays any attention to her as Lao reaches for the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside are the remains of Nur- hachi -- the first Emperor of the Manchu Dynasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao opens the box carefully and stares reverently at the powder inside. INDIANA (Cont'd) Now what about the antidote, Lao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the box) At last I have the ashes of my sacred ancestor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's the big deal?  Let me see it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qillie grabs Lao's arm and some of the precious ashes spi of the gold box.  Stunned by this desecration of his ance Lao grabs Willie by the wrist and twists her arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, you're hurting me, you miser- able little hood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her, Lao.  And give me the antidote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao just laughs evilly -- until a waiter moves up behind the crimelord suddenly stiffens.  He lets go of Willie's and raises his hands off the table.  Chen stops collectin money and jewels. Kao Kan tenses and Indy smiles at Wu Han, the Chinese wai the scar, who is standing behind Lao.  Wu Han has a towel his hand  --  under it, he has a pistol pressed against L spine. INDIANA (Cont'd) (smiling at Wu Han) I like the service here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Hey, he's not a waiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Wu Han's an old friend I brought along. (to Lao) So, the game's not over. Put the antidote on the table, Lao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao carefully reaches into his pocket and puts a small gl of liquid next to the cash, gold, jewels, poison and sacr Indy looks relieved as he reaches for the vial of antidot then he hears a muffled report!  And another! Wu Han groans and sways.  Indy starts to stand but Chen i ately turns the smoking pistol with the silencer that he kill Wu Han -- Indy sees it pointed at him now and he rem his seat. Kao Kan stands and grabs Wu Han, easing the phoney waiter the chair he just vacated.  The muffled shooting hasn't a any attention.  The nightclub activity continues an Indy emotionally to his dying friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wu Han  --  listen to me  --  I'm going to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In pain, Wu Han looks at Indy and struggles to speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time, my friend... (smiling bravely) I followed you on many adventures -- but into the great Unknown Mystery, I go first, Indy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wu Han dies and slumps forward.  Indiana is shattered by death of his old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sad, Dr. Jones -- you will soon join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's gaze shifts from his dead friend to Lao's sneering Then Indy sees the murderous Chen giggling perversely.  I anger is compounded by the poison burning in his gut and ion of Chen's ugly face blurs into a double image -- Indy stands up unsteadily.  Chen assumes he's about to ke from the poison -- but Indy suddenly turns and grabs a re ter at another table.  The waiter holds a long skewer of pigeons that he's just set afire -- Indy grabs the skewer of pigeons flambee and hurls is acr table!  Chen fires and misses -- and screams as the skewe into his chest and the burning pigeons flame in front of rified face! This the other tables definitely notice.  There are screa all hell breaks loose.  Indiana shoves past Willie and re for the vial on the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antidote -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's grabbed from behind by Kao Kan.  Indy elbows the reaches back and grabs his head -- and somersaults Kao Ka the table! As nubmer two son crashes into the table, the impact send Emperor Nurhachi's ashes billowing into Lao's stricken fa Indiana yells as he sees the vial of antidote rolling acr table -- and falling! Indiana dives and catches the antidote just before it hit floor -- then Indy's hand is brutally stomped on by one o henchmen and the vial rolls away. Indiana angrily raises his head, smashing it up into the man's groin -- the man howls like a banshee and hobbles a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Willie watches Lao grabbing for cash from the Willie lunges past the pigeon-skewered Chen to snatch the but unfortunately Kao Kan knocks them off the table as he to attack Indy. Indiana scrambles on his hands and knees after the rollin People keep kicking it -- he almost has it when Willie ru him, trips and lands on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, damn it, I need that antidote!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?  Where's that diamond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire explodes and they both scramble in different dire Indy dives through the fleeing nightclub patrons and slid hind a water-spewing fountain.  Water kicks up as Indy is by Lao and his henchmen. Indy sees the vial of antidote kicked again and it spins the marble floor -- feeling the poison, Indy shakes his h groddily and splashes water on his face. Meanwhile, Willie is chasing her diamond, shoving through panicked crowd.  She spots the diamond!  Another elegantl dresses soman is bending to pick it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acidly polite) Excuse me, but I believe that's my diamond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie smiles and suddenly kicks the woman in the butt! reaches to get the diamond but not before the other woman her. Behind the fountain, Indiana makes a break -- he runs and on top of a serving cart.  The wheeled cart hurtles towar suspecting gunman, crashes into him from behind and sends flying head first into a row of ice buckets. Nearby, Willie slugs the other lady in the jaw and grabs elusive diamond just as the ice buckets showers ice acros floor -- which camouflages the diamond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching desperately for the jewel, Willie sees the vial antidote spinning across the floor --as it slides by, she it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey,doll!  Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Indy speeding by atop the serving cart.  Lao and gunmen rush out to block the way.  Indy rolls off the car slides behind a potted palm as Lao's men open fire again. INDIANA (Cont'd) (shouting to Willie) Hey, don't go away!  I need that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie smiles meanly as she slips the vial down the front dress, thumbs her nose at Indiana and walks away. INDIANA (Cont'd) If I wasn't dying, I'd kill her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding behind the palm tree, Indiana looks around and spo ant statue at the side of the stage.  Indy makes a break As the gunmen open fire, Indy springs onto a chair -- jum a table -- and leaps onto the stage.  He grabs the golden sword from the Chinese warrior statue! As bullets smash into the statue, Indiana hides behind it he jumps out and swings the large sword toward the enormo gong. The crimson cord holding the gong is SLASHED!  Indy sling sword at his assailants and gives the three-meter-high go helpful shove -- The giant gong rolls and echoes as it crashes down the ma steps.  Indiana ducks behind it as it gains momentum and across the dance floor. Using the gong as an enormous shield, Indy evades the gun ploding -- bullets ricochet off the rolling brass gong as runs behind it. Ahead, Willie hurries toward an exit -- she hears somethi turns -- her eyes go wide as she sees the mammoth gong be down on her! Willie yells as Indiana grabs her arm and pulls her behin gong with him -- Lao watches amazed as he and his gunmen dodge tables tryi get better firing positions -- and more henchmen come int club now and start firing machine guns! As bullets clang against the gong, Indiana and Willie run it.  Willie hollers as they head directly for a towering, to-ceiling window! Indiana grabs Willie around the waist and, after the huge crashes through the stained-glass window, they both fly a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a shower of sparkling glass, the enormous gong sails o crashes down a sloping green-tiled roof.  Indiana Jones a lie Scott hurtle into the night air after it! The gong rolls down the roof and they hit the tiles behin Indiana holding onto Willie as they roll one-over-the-oth toward the edge -- Willie screams as they fall into thin Their entwined bodies plummet three stories:  ripping thr third-floor awning, crashing through an old man's mattres second-floor balcony -- Finally they smash through the convertible top of a parke berg and fall into the back seat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie sits up wide-eyed, speechless and amazed to be ali Then she sees an equally astonished Short Round looking a from the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!  Holy smoke!  Crash landing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step on it, Short Round!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey doke, Indy!  Hold onto your potatoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twelve-year-old Chinese kid turns his baseball cap bi backwards and steps on the gas!  The tires squeal as the roars off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For crying out loud, a kid's driv- ing the car?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I've been giving him lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg races past the entrace to the nightclub as and his man rush out and jump into two black sedans.  The screech off in pursuit of the Duesenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Short Round eagerly swerves around a corner, Willie ho for dear life.  Indiana suddenly puts his hand down the f Willie's dress --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we just met for crissake! I'm not that kind of gril!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your hopes up -- where's the antidote?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana withdraws his hand, having finally found the vial opens is quickly, tips the vial to his lips and grimaces swallows the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison never agrees with me. (shouting forward) Pull a right, Short Round, and head for the Wang Poo bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check!  Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car accelerates, Indy peers out the back window at pursuers.  Willie notices her reflection in the side wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at what you've done to me! I'm a mess!  My lipstick's smeared, I broke two nails, I've got an aw- ful run in my stocking -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire suddenly explodes, bullets whizz through the canv and the rear window shatters and sprays glass!  Willie du cringes terrified in the corner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow I think you've got bigger problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy grabs his shoulder bag and pulls a pistol out of it. pokes the gun through the broken window and starts firing their pursuers -- then he turns and looks ahead. INDIANA (Cont'd) There, Shorty!  Through the tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windows we see the car racing into a tunnel. from the pursuing cars flash through the rear window and echoes in the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we going to do?!  Where're we going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport...No, look out, Short Round!  Left, left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy reaches over the front seat and helps Short Round na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg tears around the square, followed by Lao's dans.  People on the street dive for cover -- coolies pul rickshaws go into hyper-jov --lanterns spanning the stree down and are dragged behind the Duesenberg.  Bullets exlo amazed prostitutes watch the cars zoom past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chaotic chase continues -- bullets whine past and the ded convertible top whips in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) You got the tickets, Short Round?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Indy -- three tickets! You, me and Wu Han --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty throws an envelope back and Indy looks at the thre tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) Wu Han's not coming, Shorty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of what happened at the club, Short Round thinks ment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Indy.  Short Round number one bodyguard now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie reaches for the extra ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the extra ticket. (grabbing it from Indy) Where's this plane going anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siam?  But I'm not dressed for Siam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving behind the squalid port, the Duesenberg flies alo highway through the trees.  In a moment, Lao's two sedans by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg swings around a curve and skids through gr ward the airfield.  In the distance there is a small term Short Round wheels the car toward the cargo area -- A two-engine passenger plane is revving its motors and th passengers are boarding.  The Duesenberg squeals to a sto Indy jumps out with Willie and Short Round right on his h A contingent of airport Military Police move to bar their until WEBER, a heavy-set Englishman, runs up pufffing and ing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, they're all right! Let them through please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Weber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones, this is positively the last time our airline can hold a plane for you.  Now you must hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Short Round grabs a small bag out of the car, Weber stewardess take their tickets and rush them all toward th plane. Meanwhile, the two sedans skid to a stop and Lao and his Kan jumpsout with their henchmen.  The puzzled military p advance on them usspiciously  -- Realizing he's outnumbered, Lao instructs his men to stay and to put away their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie and Short Round charge up the ladder and onto the Indy pauses at the top of the steps to give Lao a cocky f salute.  Indy boards the plane and the co-pilot slams the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane starts taxiing.  By the cars, Lao is buffeted b prop wash as he angrily watches the plane roll away.  Beh his son, Kao Kan, stares at the plane taking off  -- a lo Kan's face indicates that he hasn't given up yet... The plane lifts off the airfield, silhouetted against the and the first light of dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun flashes above the horizon and the plane banks thr white billowing clouds at it heads west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens at the rear of the plane and Indiana Jones e wearing more familiar attire:  a beat-up leather jacket o khaki shirt and a snap-brim hat.  He passes a dozen passe he moves up the aisle carrying his rolled-up tuzedo. In the first row, Willie is busy fixing her make-up.  Sho in the seat across the aisle from her.  Indy comes up and his tuxedo onto the floor. Willie sees him hook his coiled bullwhip over a coat-peg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what're you supposed to be, a lion tamer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was nice enough to let you tag along, why don't you give your mouth a rest?  Okay, doll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy pats her leg -- she removes his hand and reaches dow picks up his tuxedo coat.  She slips it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm freezing.  What do you mean, tag along?  From the minute you walked into that nightclub, you haven't been able to keep your eyes off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and tips his hat down over his eyes to go to sl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same moment, the Chinese co-pilot tips his hat up eyes -- and looks scared to death!  He exclaims in Chines CO-PILOT (*subtitled*) Good lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the pilot see two biplanes materialize out of the and dive directly toward them!  Suddenly, machine gunfire PILOT (*subtitled) Dive for the clouds!  Dive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DC-3 banks into the clouds as the two biplanes attack the back seat of the first biplane, we see Kao Kan watchi DC-3 like a hawk about to bring down a sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biplanes swoop past both sides of the plane and burst gunfire rip along the fuselage. CO-PILOT (*subtitled) They hit a fuel line! PILOT (*subtitled*) Reduce speed -- get everyone out of the plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the air battle rages, the passengers are tossed about start screaming.  Short Round peers out a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lao send planes to kill Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie shakes Indy's arm but he continues snoring under h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!  It's the drug he drank to stop the poison --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockpit door bursts open and the Chinese co-pilot exi make an announcement -- he smiles and speaks in CHINESE, smiles and speaks in FRENCH -- Willie looks lost until the Chinese co-pilot smiles again speaks in ENGLISH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please to remain calm.  We start passing out parachutes now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The co-pilot hurries toward the rear.  Willie looks petri a stewardess rushes up and hands her a parachute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding!  No!  No, I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot hurries out of the cockpit and grabs his parach he heads toward the back. WILLIE (Cont'd) Wait -- who's flying the plane?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to the cockpit -- WILLIE (Cont'd) Nobody's flying the plane ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DC-3 smokes through the clouds.  Passengers are baili -- parachutes billowing.  As one of the fighters swoops t the parachutes, Kao Kan searches the faces -- then he poi the DC-3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Jones!  Indiana Jones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two planes roar off and start strafing the DC-3 again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The co-pilot has a parachute on and is trying to get Shor into one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on!  What's wrong with you?  You've got to jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, can't leave Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round suddenly butts the co-pilot in the stomach wi head.  The co-pilot yells and falls out the door.  Short sees the co-pilot's parachute billow.  Then Willie rushes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that parachute, I changed my mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the parachute and starts to fight Shorty over i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this last one!  It's for Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scuffle until the parachute skids across the floor. Round jumps for it -- the parachute falls out the door an Round starts to fall out after it! Willie grabs him by the seat of his pants and hauls him b the abyss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters peel off toward the DC-3 with their guns fla another attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round tries to wake Indy again.  Finally, Shorty gr Indy's bag, pulls his holster out of it and runs toward t Indy continues to sleep -- until bullets smash the window head and a fire extinguisher is hit and starts spraying i Indy's face. He finally awakens and jumps up.  He looks around is disb the battle-torn, nearly-empty airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggily) We there yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana sees Shorty shooting his pistol out the side door planes swoop by again.  Out of ammo, Shorty throws the gu angrily at the passing plane. Indiana picks up his whip and attaches it to his belt as runs over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody flying the plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and Indy rushes in with Willie behind Indy appraises the situation quickly and jumps into the p seat with total confidence -- WILLIE (Cont'd) You know how to fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy surveys the control panels, the myraid of dials and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (hopefully) Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie runs screaming out of the cockpit, her last hope s ed.  Shorty is pulling something out of the cargo compart he's found a machine gun and sets it up on a short tripod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, lady, hold this and shut up please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls Willie down to the floor and shoves her the ammu belt that's draped toward the gun.  Then Shorty jumps beh machine gun -- As the first fighter appears off their side, Short Round out the open door!  The machine gun explodes to life, che bullets, smoking and spitting shells at Willie -- Willie hollers terrified by manages to feed the ammo belt Short Round sights the blazing machine gun -- suddenly he Willie sees the fighter hit -- it smokes and veers away - then EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second plane swoops down and Short Round blasts away. time as he swivels the gun, he misses and hits one of the own engines and it explodes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh oh -- big mistake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to figure out the controls, Indy looks up to see t gine explose into flames --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Short Round, what in the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the DC-3 emerges out of a cloud and Indy sees th headed directly for a mountain!  He pulls back hard on th trols as a rocky peak looms lethally in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DC-3 lifts at the last second and smashes some snow o uppermost pinnacle as it clears the mountain by inches! Kao Kan's fighter is glued to the DC-3's tail and continu strafe -- but the fighter pilot pulls up too late -- and fighter explodes as it hits the peak of the mountain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy rushes out of the smoking cockpit to find Willie and Round crawling out from under the debris that's fallen on Then Indy spots something in the wreckage -- He pulls at some yellow canvas and Willie sees as sign: E LIFE RAFT.  Indy drags the folded canvas over to the open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy, a lift raft?!  We're not sinking, we're crashing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here, damn it!  Short Round, come on, grab onto me tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie sees Short Round rush over to Indiana and grab him the waist from behind.  Willie finally jumps up and runs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws her arms around Indy's neck so that she and Sh both hugging him from behind.  Indy clutches the folded l in front of him and surveys the mountainside rushing clos neath the skinking airplane -- Finally, an instant before the plane will hit, Indy dives pulls the inflation cord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the smoking DC-3 screams out of control toward the mou skimming the rocky snow-covered slopes, we see the lift r spilling out the open door -- The raft pops into its full shape, acting now as a spoile ing against the rushing wind and finally crashing and bou against the snowy mountainside. In the distance, we see the DC-3 finally kiss the earth a plode in a cloud of flame against a rocky escarpment -- m earth mushrooming in a million directions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the raft rockets down the snow, Indiana clutches the f Willie and Short Round hold on for dear life on either si him. The raft plummets down the mountain, crossing the timber- entering a forest.  Bouncing over a snow-hidden log, the shoots directly for a tree -- Indiana pulls on the perimeter rope, rolls on his side an ages to swerve the raft so it caroms offthe snow-drifted the tree trunk. Continuing its downhill run, the raft smashes across a sm steam, sending silvery water spraying. As the raft skids below the snow-level, it starts bouncin rocky ground and its three passengers' teeth start chatte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yellow raft crashes through a tangle of bushes and th mets toward a bluff!  The raft goes airborne over a small and lands with a splash in a slow-moving river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The life raft drifts down the river and Indy looks around smiles cockily at Willie and Short Round -- Their faces don't show gratitude, but horror -- Indy hear thing and turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raft is heading directly toward a surging stretch of erous rapids.  Indiana looks less cocky as he and Willie Short Round hold on again for dear life! The raft plunges into the roaring torrent, bouncing over swollen waves, twisting and spinning through narrow gaps. three helpless passengers are drenched in the thundering of white water. Willie is hallering, Short Round hangs on wide-eyed and e looks terrified as the raft crashes down the rapids.  Fin after one heart-stopping bounce, the raft seems to slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raft drifts out of the main part of the river and gli ward a clearing.  Its three soaked and bedraggled passeng motionless in the bottom. Indy's hand drags alongside the raft, his fingers leaving in the almost still water.  Battered and exhausted, but a Indy's "bodyguard", Shorty looks over at him worriedly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Shorty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks over at Willie who is moaning. INDIANA (Cont'd) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead. (moaning) Oh no...I ripped my dress.  Where are we anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raft floats to a gentle stop -- we see it nudge again pair of dark feet.  Indy squints up into the sun and sees thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: India...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow -- India?  How do you know we're in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls over and yelps as she looks up at the bizarre, face of a SHAMAN.  Silhoutted against the blazing sun, th ny little old man in a loincoloth stares down at them in An eerie wind rises and howls.  The old man places his pa gether and moves his hands up to touch his forehead.  Wil Short Round watch mystified as Indiana returns the old sh silent greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indya and Short Round follow the shaman and four peasants gutted path through barren rolling hills.  Willie is out milieu, stumbling along this forlorn landscape in high he tuxedo jacket and disheveled lame gown. She hears the old shaman talking to Indy and catches up w to find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Indiana) What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me they knew I was coming here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean -- how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man saw it in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream -- nightmare is more like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her bewildered face and smiles faintly.  As t walk, a hot wind swirls dust around them,  a wind slowly what soil is left in this terribly blighted region.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of the hills, Mayapore village does nothing t lieve the awful sense of devastation.  A desolate road ru through the village, along which groups of ptiifully poor lagers stare at the strangers being brought in. Hopeless women lift buckets from a dry well -- finding on Skinny miserable dogs skulk between the decrepit village eyed by the patient vultures lurling in scraggly trees. Indiana notices the wretched peasants staring at Short Ro some of them pointing at him, a few haggard women sheddin down their wrinkled faces as the little Chinese boy passe There is no sign of children in the village and Short Rou frightened by the odd attention.  He moves closer to Indy pass the devastated population.

dialogues.speaker: RXT. MAYAPORE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Black clouds clot across the blood-red sky as darkness fa Indiana, Willie and Short Round sit tensely on a shabby r Above their heads, there is a thatched roof, but there ar walls. The dying sunset silhouettes them and the half-dozen elde ed in the dirt around them.  A grey-haired man, the villa CHIEFTAIN, gives quiet commands to the women who scuttle set wooden plates in front of the three visitors.  No pla places in front of the elders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Indy) I hope this means we're going to get some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana sees the painted shaman, who sits next to the chi watching Willie.  The women bring in a bowl from which th tiny portions of grey gruel onto three plates. To this the women add a few grains of yellowed rice and a ered ,molding piece of fruit.  Willie looks aghast at the tizing combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) God, I am starving, but I can't eat this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more food than these people eat in a week. (pointedly)  They're starving, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks around at the emaciated faces and feels like ing into a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I -- here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her plate and gently hands it back to the wo The chieftain finally speaks to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will rest here before you go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd appreciate that.  This was an unexpected detour.  We'll have to go to Delhi now and find a flight west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Indy is taking me to America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Short Round.  Puzzled by this strange att Shorty's smile fades nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a professor.  I have to re- turn to the university.  Can you give us a guide to take us to Delhi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chieftain indicates a young villager sitting near the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanju will guide you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old shaman speaks now for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the way to Delhi, you will stop at Pankot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Pankot isn't on the way to Delhi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will go to palace there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't the Pankot palace been de- serted since the Mutiny of 1857?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly) No. Now there is new Maharajah -- and palace is powerful again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaman looks around at his unfortunate people. SHAMAN (Cont'd) It is Pankot Palace that kills my village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  What's hap- pened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The evil starts in Pankot.  Then like monsoon, it moves darkness over all country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What evil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came from Palace and took sivalinga from out village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks over at Indiana --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sacred stone in a shine that's supposed to protect a village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is why Krishna brought you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely firm) Nobody brought us here.  Our plane crashed.  We were shot down by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No.  We pray to Krishna to help us find the stone.  It was Krishna who made you fall from sky -- so you can got to Pankot Palace.  To find siva- linga -- and bring back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's about to object -- then he looks at the sad chieft elders and peasants who are watching him helplessly.  And again the dark steady eyes of the old shaman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torches falre eerily and dogs howl as the peasants accomp shaman, elders and three visitors out ot the edge of the village.  Short Round walks beside Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, they make out plane crash? To get you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just superstition, Shorty. Like a ghost story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round looks plenty scared as they all stop walking. shaman motions and the men with torches circle around a p rocks to illuminate them.  The shaman makes a gesture of to the primitive shrine and Indy speaks to the village ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana seems skeptical as he kneels to study the shrine. of the pile of rocks, there is a carved niche.  The niche empty but an indentation indicates the conical shape of t that was stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the stone very smooth? (he sees the chieftain nod) It was probably brought here from a sacred river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining Indy and the chieftain) Long ago -- before my father's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it had three lines painted across it? (seeing the shaman nod) The lines represent the three levels of the universe.  I've seen stones like the one you lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stands slowly.  Willie is beside him looking at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand how losing one rock could destroy this village. (whispering to Indy) Is it really powerful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy gives a doubtful smile.  He turns again to the old s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why would the Maharajah take this sacred stone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say we must pray to their evil god.  We say we will not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old shaman looks off and fights the tears in his eyes starts speaking in Hindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) He says that when the sacred stone was taken the village wells dried up first and then the river stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy turns and asks the shaman a question in Hindi.  The answers in Hindi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) He says their crops dies and then the animals died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaman walks to the edge of the torchlight and looks the darkness as he continues speaking emotionally in Hind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) And then they took their children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Short Round and finally understands the sorr faces always watching him.  Indy asks another question in and the shaman continues his story --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) He says one night there was a fire in the fields.  The men went to fight it.  When they came back, they heard the women crying in the darkness.  And the children were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaman walks slowly toward Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will find them when you find sivlalinga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I don't know how I can help you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaman and the chieftain stare and Indiana, refusing that. INDIANA (Cont'd) The English authorities who con- trol this area are the only ones who can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do not listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have friends in Delhi and I will make sure they investigate this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you will got to Pankot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man speaks again in his own tongue and Indy looks turbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was destined that I came here -- and the future cannot be changed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks ath the shaman and the torchlight reflected in eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we're rushing headlong down a dark dirt path see the POV of somebody running in terror.  We hear heavy bre -- above we see the scraggly trees blowing against the fu as an eerie wind rises and howls.  We continue crashing t the dying fields tward the dark village...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind swirls into the hut and Indiana's eyes open.  He still a moment and then sits up slowly.  He sees Short Ro sleeping nearby. Sensing something strange, Indy gets to his feet.  He ste around Short Round and goes to the door of the hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy walks against the rising wind and looks around.  The is asleep and seems deserted.  Then he turns and sees som We follow small bare feet stumbling through the dust... Indy sees an emaciated child in rag running out of the da Indiana moves forward and the child runs toward him.  Ind the little boy as he falls into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minutes later, the little boy is lying unconscious blanket.  Elders crouch around him.  Indy is kneeling and the shaman wet the boy's forehead with a rag and drip wat his lips. The little boy's eyes open and he begins to revive.  Shro And Willie watch from a corner as the little boy looks at faces peering down at him. The little boy's arm moves and he reaches out to Indy rat any of the others.  Indy takes his small hand and sees th boy's fingers are cut and bruised -- his fingers open and something into Indy's hand. The little boy tries to whisper.  Indy has to lean close as the little boy's lips move again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sankara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mother rushes into the hut now and kneels and hugs her boy.  His skinny arms go around her as they are reunited. stands slowly and looks at what the little boy gave him - It is a small tattered piece of cloth:  an old fragment o ature painting.  Indiana looks at it with an expression o nition and apprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sankara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera follows Indiana -- he's walking fast and deter ly.  Villagers trot alongside of him, trying to keep up w pace as he questions thm in Hindi. Indy approaches two large elephants and sees their guide trying to politely drag Willie toward one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it , Willie, get on -- we've got to move out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie's head comes up over the back of the elephant as s helped from below -- there is a look of sheer terror on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  Easy now -- nice elephant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting by the second elephant, Short Round sees Indy com runs up to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ride with you, Indy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, you got a little surprise over there, Shorty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round runs around the big elephant and sees a baby being brought out.  He can't believe his luck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Sajnu goads Willie's elephant over.  The villag grief stricken and many are crying as they watch the thre gers' departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Short Round) This is the first time anybody ever cried when I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't cry about you.  They cry about the elephants leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got no food to feed them.  So they taking the elephants away to sell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy lumbers over on his elephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's go.  I want to get to Pankot before tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Indiana as he rides past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pankot?!  I thought we were going to Delhi!  Hey, wait a minute! (looking at the villagers) Can't somebody take me to Delhi?! I don't want to go to Pankot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sajnu guides her elephant and Willie lurches forward -- WILLIE (Cont'd) (yelling)  Indiana!  Damn it!  Why'd you change your mind?  What did that kid tell you last night?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy ignores her hollering.  The elephants move off throu crowds of pitiful villagers.  Indy sees the elders, chief the old shaman who brings his hands up to his forehead as rides past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elephants move across the desolate countryside toward distant hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana rides the lead elephant.  Sajnu passes on foot gu Willie's elephant.  With the tuxedo jacket wrapped around waist, Willie is dabbing perfume behind her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her elephant) I think you need this more than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie leans forward and puts perfume behind the elephant Grimacing at the animal's smell she simply dumps the rest perfume on the elephant's back. Willie yelps when the elephant's trunk comes back, sniffs foriegn fragrance and suddenly trumpets in disgust. WILLIE (Cont'd) What're you complaining about, this is expensive stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a cliff, we see the elephants below passing into the jungles. Spotting something on an overhanging tree branck, Short R stands up precariously on the baby elephant's back.  He p vine from the tree as they pass under it.  Plopping down baby elephant's back, he picks the wild fruit from the vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, lunch time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby elephant's trunk comes back and takes the fruit. looks up in the sky. SHORT ROUND (Cont'd) Indy, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Willie look up and see hundreds of enormous w creatures flapping across the afternoon sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are very big bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sajnu says something and Indiana nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those aren't birds -- those are giant bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie shudders as she watches the bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous sun silhouettes the three elephants trekking ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three elephants stand sucking up river water with the trunks.  Seated on the huge beasts, Willie, Short Round a ana watch the thirsty animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be pretty dumb to drink that awful-looking water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response, Willie's elephant calmly lifts its trunk and her in the face.  Short Round and Indy laugh as Willie si soaked and shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe we'll camp here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plume of water sprays.  The three elephants submerge in wide spot in the river.  Indy wades in the current with h off.  He and the guide splash water on the weary animals. Short Round laughs and plays with the baby elephant.  Wra its trunk, he's swung in the air and lands on the elephan back.  Shorty makes a swan dive back into the water and t elephant gives him a shower when he surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty yards upstream, birds and monkeys chatter in a tre the shady river beneath, Willie surfaces cooly and wipes from her eyes.  She hums contendedly. Indiana wanders up the riverbank in his dripping trousers notices Willie's wet clothes spread over a tree limb hang over the water and then he sees Willie paddling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Willie -- I think you better get out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark naked?  You wish... If you're trying to seduce me, Dr. Jones, this is a very primitive approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me seduce you?  Honey, you're the one who took your clothes off. (shrugging) I just came over to remind you that you never know what else might be in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow I feel safer in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Indy turns and starts off, Willie reaches up to the tr branch above her head and grabs her underwear.  At this m notice something awful: A BOA CONSTRICTOR is moving out along the branch, the eno snake slithering over Willie's clothes. Willie watches Indiana walk away as she reaches up for he -- her hands feel something strange -- not the dress and tree limb -- Willie looks up and sees that she's pulling on a snake! S SCREAMS as the boa constrictor falls off the t-ee on top Indy hears the scream and hears Willie calling to him.  H back toward the river.  Stopping on the riverbank, he see backing away in the water -- Indiana's already starting t his boots off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy!  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm coming in!  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Indiana freezes and a strange look corsses his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNAKE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally sees the boa constrictor thrashing in the wate to Willie.  He leaves his boots on. WILLIE (Cont'd) Hurry, help me out of here! What're you waiting for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, listen -- Willie -- I got a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all -- don't panic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie suddenly screams as the boa constrictor wraps arou arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got me !  Indy, help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy runs along the riverbank, trying to get closer to he not about to jump into the river (due to his aversion to -- see Episode One:  "Raiders of the Lost Ark").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let it pull you deeper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pulling me deeper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let it curl around you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's curling around me!  Damn it, stop talking and do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake is wrapping around her body and neck -- her hea barely above water -- On the riverbank, Indy reaches down and grabs a piece of But as he watches the repulsive reptile, he starts to swe his fear and loathing overpower him -- WILLIE (Cont'd) What's wrong?!  Indy please help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy groans and bolsters his courage -- he takes two step the water -- but the complex is to strong and he can't go further.  He drops the piece of wood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Willie.  Do exactly what I tell you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you move your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I want you to lift your hand -- and pet the snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PET IT                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, stroke it right along the maxillary and precaudal verte- brae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WHAT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pet it on the head!  Go on, pet it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the water, Willie is whimpering as she lifts her hand starts petting the snake  coiling around her pale body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- my -- god -- it's going to crush me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep stroking it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie keeps rubbing her hand along the snakes head and b it slowly stops thrashing in the water. INDIANA (Cont'd) What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting to let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good  -- you're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimacing as she stares at the ugly serpent's head, Willi stroking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's letting fo.  I think it's -- I think it's going to sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana looks relieved.  He sees the snake starting to dr from Willie and she starts paddling back to shore, collec floating clothes along the way. Holding her dripping dress against herself, she walks out water toward Indy who smiles at her weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See -- I got you out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slows and hauls off and punches him in the mouth.  In his jaw as she walks away infuriates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for nothing!  I hate snakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the water) I know the feeling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By firelight, we see Sajnu feeding the big elephants whil Round feeds and talks to the baby elephant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to America with me, and we can get job in the circus -- you like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby elephant trumpets affirmitively. A ways off, Willie stands wrapped in a blanket watching S and the elephant as she dries her hair by a campfire.  No comes up and drops an armload of wood for yet another fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find your little body- guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met Short Round when he tried to pick my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana kneels and arranges the wood. INDIANA (Cont'd) Shorty's family was killed when they bombed Shanghai.  He was living on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) He'll be okay.  He's a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy strikes a match and lights the new fire. WILLIE (Cont'd) All these fires -- you expecting more snakes, Dr. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles snidely and continues drying her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, how'd you end up in Shanghai?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when my nightclub career was run over by the Depression, some pinhead convinced me that "a girl could go places in the Orient..." So, look where I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy picks up a blanket and spreads it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's easy -- I'm going to latch onto a good-looking, in- credibly rich prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy lies down on the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to find one of those myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising an eyebrow) Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he's got to be dead and buried for a couple of thousand years. (smiling) Fortune and glory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're hoping to find at this palace, Dr. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy reaches into his pocket and removes the old piece of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to where he's lying down and sits on a bou He hands her the cloth and she looks at it by the firelig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that kid gave me last night.  It's a piece of an old manuscript.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie sees a crude drawing in reds, blue and gold. INDIANA (Cont'd) The drawing shows a priest named Sankara who lived centuries ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does the writing say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sanskrit.  It tells the story of Sankara climbing Mt. Kalisa where he met the Hindu god Shiva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining it) That's Shiva?  What's he giving the Priest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend says he told Sankara to go forth and combat evil.  To do that he gave him five sacred stones that had magical powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Indy) You mean magical like the rock that was stolen from that village?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks at her meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie seems frightened.  She hands him the piece of clot stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Fortune and glory...sweet dreams, Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a blanket and starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should sleep closer. (seeing her sus- picious look) I meant for safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'd be safer sleeping with that snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps over to a tree by the fire where her clothes ar ing.  Indy watches her pull her dried clothes from the lo branches. She reaches up to remove another piece of her clothing -- stuck to the tree and she looks up and yanks it.  Suddenl piece of clothing moves! Two enormous winds open and the hideous face of a GIANT B screeches and hisses at Willie!  She screams hysterically bat flaps against her, biting and scratching at her befor nally takes off. The bat flies off into the darkness and Indy chuckles as watches Willie shanking as she backs slowly toward the fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see it?!  It was one of those bats! (staring into the darkness) God, what else is out there...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly picks up her blanket and lays it out very clo Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't keep away, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try and control yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana watches her lie down and wrap herself in her blan then he rolls over and tips his hat down over his eyes to some well-deserved shut-eye. In a moment, however, we see something grotesque and snak slide into frame and move towards Indy -- finally, we rea it's an elephant's trunk.  The trunk nudges Indy's should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking) Still scared?  Okay, Willie, you can get closer if you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elephant's trunk moves closer and nuzzles Indy's neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I knew you'd be the first one to give in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we see that Short Round is guiding the baby elephant with a prod.  Willie watches, stifling a laugh as the ele trunk sniffs Indiana's ear -- INDIANA (Cont'd) You're going to start something I'm going to have to finish. (moaning) Okay, doll, you asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana rolls over, lifts his hat and hollers!  He nearly out of his pants as he stares into the elephant's trunk. and Short Round dissolve into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall, vine-covered trees sway in the wind.  Beneath them, ephants plough through the dense tropical forest.  The so the teeming jungle multiply as Short Round surveys the di hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Pankot Palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks off at the resplendent while Moghul-style pa sing in the distance above the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their Mayapore guide walks toward the camera and suddenly frightened.  He barks commands and the elephants stop.  I jumps down an joins the fearful guide. They stare at a small statue of a malevolent goddess with arms.  Around the goddess's neck, a carved necklace displ small human heads -- her eight hands hold other heads by hair. Indiana moves closer to the statue as the terrified guide away.  Indy is fascinated by the ritual objects adorning leaves, dead birds, rodents and turtles.  Indiana grimace lifts a necklace of real pierced human fingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana goes back and joins the scared, jabbering guide w helping Willie down from the elephant.  Short Round jumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you look at, Indy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the guide talking about? He hasn't said a word the whole trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy listens to the agitated guide and then speaks a few Hindi back to him.  They watch the distressed guide trun phants and start away with them as fast as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's afraid of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he couldn't take us any farther.  He has to go sell the elephants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean we have to walk the rest of the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie moans and follows Indy.  Short Round watches the e trudging away.  The little elephant turns and looks back. Round quickly wipes a tear from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Short Round hike up a rock-paved road beside wall.  Exhausted, carrying her high heels, Willie trudges behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- shot at, fallen out of a plane, nearly drowned, squashed by a snake, attacked by a bat -- I smell like an elephant! (yelling) I tell you I'm not going to make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana finally stops.  He walks back to Willie, suddenly her us in his arms and starts carrying her the remaining Willie is surprised and puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more complaints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling faintly) Yeah, I wish you'd thought of this sooner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't seem to mind being carried by Indy.  He arriv the entrance to the palace and puts her down -- she stand to him and he gently smoothes the collar of her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't feel like there's been any permanent damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him again and then turns around -- and whis she sees Pankot Palace:  a sprawling, monumental mixture ghul and Rajput styles, the palace is an extravaganza of architecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three travelers start across a marble bridge toward t entrance.  Lined along the bridge, palace guards stand wi lances. As the threesome passes, the first Rajput guard snaps noi attention and Willie jumps.  As Willie continues across t bridge, the other guards snap to attention in sequence an grins, enjoying the attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round and Willie follow Indiana through a dark arch a glittering courtyard.  The palace seems deserted and fo ing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?...(hello?)...(hello?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's voice echoes off the marble facades -- three enorm put guards with curved swords in their sashes appear sile opposite sides of the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) Hi...(hi)...(hi)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a tall severe-looking Indian in an English suit mat izes out of the shadows and comes forward slowly.  CHATTA appraises the intruders suspiciously: He sees a whoozy beauty in a weary evening gown;  a dirty kid with a baseball cap; a rugged-looking American carryi bullwhip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say you look rather lost. (disdainfullt) But then I cannot imagine where in the world the three of you would look at home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling evenly) Lost?  No, we're not lost.  We're on our way to Delhi.  This is Miss Scott -- and Mr. Round.  My name's Indiana Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Dr. Jones?  The eminent archae- ologist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe, isn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember first hearing your name when I was studying at Oxford.  I Am Chattar Lal, Prime Minister for His Highness the Maharajah of Pankot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bows and Willie sort of curtsies. CHATTAR LAL (Cont'd) Welcome to Pankot Palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk along the marble halls, past dazzling walls inl pieces of mirror and semi-precious stones.  Fountains spr ivory countyards and they gaze in awe at the ornate splen As Willie walks with Shorty she appraises the chronolgoic portraits of the Pankot Prices that line the hall.  Dissi faces, elegant faces, evil faces -- she reacts to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Short Round) How'd you like to run into him in a dark alley...that one's kind of cute...I could see myself married to a prince like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of them Chattar Lal  walks with Indy and questions suspiciously --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane crash and your journey here sound -- most incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have been there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd appreciate it if the Mahara- jah would let us stay tonight. We'll be on out way in the morn- ing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am only his humble servant, but the Maharajah usually listens to my advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've come to the last in the row of Princes portraits. lie stops and looks up disappointedly at a picture of an immensely corpulent Rajput prince. WILLIE (Cont'd) (politely) He's not exactly what we call "a spring chicken".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, that is Uhmed Singh, the present Maharajah's late father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- good.  And maybe the pres- ent Marahajah is a little younger? And thinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two female servants approach silently and bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will escort you to your rooms now.  You will be provided with fresh clothes.  Tonight you will be dining with His Highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?  And with a prince?!  My luck is changing.  But look at me -- my god, I've to to get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurried off with one of the servants toward her room. tar Lal smiles cooly at Indiana --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock in the Pleasure Pavilion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extraordinary gold dome rises in the middle of the ele gardens.  The Pleasure Pavilion is ablaze with torch ligh flickering candles and exotic music. Indiana comes out of the palace with Short Round.  Indy h tweed jacket and a nectie -- his university professor's o Short Round has been cleaned up, but still sports his bas cap. Willie joins them, looking stunning is a silk Western-sty gown.  She's also been loaned some Moghul jewelry which s on her neck and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie's flattered by the first nice thing Indy's said to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sort of like being in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross the garden toward the pavilion and Willie's ey like a kid's at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter, Indiana gives a half-dressed dancing girl once-over as she spins to the music of drums and "vinhas"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I've always had a weakness for folk dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snidely) She might get away with that act here, but she'd never make it in a real nightclub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk among the rich court ministers and Indian merch Chattar Lal approaches with a British cavalry captain in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are fortunate tonight to have some many unexpected guests.  his is Captain Phillip Blumburtt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blumburtt bows to Willie and Indiana. CHATTAR LAL (Cont'd) Captain Blumburtt and his troops are here to check up on the "natives".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) Just a routine inspection tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The British worry so about their Emprie -- it makes us feel like well-cared-for children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mr. Lal, what do you call the Maharajah's  wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Highness has not yet taken a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) No?  Well, I guess he just hasn't met the right woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Willie chatters on with the Prime Minister, Indiana wa off.  He moves to a wall where bronze statues and strange tional objects are displayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining Indy) Interested in local curios?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I am interested in the occult.  And this is a krtya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana picks up a small clay figurine and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing) Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the voodoo dolls of West Africa.  The kryta represents your enemy -- and gives you complete power over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That God all that mumbo jumbo rubbish is disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Admittedly, it's taken time.  Britian's controlled India for almost two hundred eyars now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
