dialogues.text: Indiana smiles at the somewhat pompous bureaucrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hanging on better here than you did in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling sourly) This is a different situation, Dr. Jones.  These people are like children.  We have to lead them slowly into the twentieth century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana puts the doll down and looks over at Chattar Lal Willie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prime Minister doesn't seem that naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's a very shrewd old boy. Power behind the throne and all that.  He actually runs this whole province.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and the Prime Minister exchange distant looks as Wil comes back over to Indiana.  She talks to him conspirator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this Maharajah is swim- ming in money.  Maybe coming here wasn't such a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blumburtt finds these Americans quite suspect and seems r when he hears a drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we're being called to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the drum beats the assembled guests move toward a long table surrounded by colorful pillows.  Short Round follow little monkey he's found perched on his arm. As everyone stands around the table, Chattar Lal makes an nouncement in Hindi and then in English --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Supremem Highness, guardian of Rajput tradition -- the Maharajah of Pankot -- Zalim Singh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on two solid silver doors which open -- and which now walks the MAHARAJAH ZALIM SINGH.  Everyone is b including Indiana and Willie, who looks amazed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Maharajah -- that kid?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he likes older women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, Zalim Singh is only thirteen.  Outfitted in silve gold brocade, festooned with enormous jewels, the litlle jah gazes imperiously at the bowing crowd -- and then gla Short Round. Indy sees Short Round chewing gum, staring antagonistical the Maharajah.  Indy pushes SHort Round into a bowing pos The Maharajah finally sits down on golden pillows.  He no his guests take their seats.  Indiana sees Willie's dream queendom have vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, you lost your prince, but dinner's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been so hungry in my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants appear with silver platters of steaming food.  T place a platter in front of Willie and she stares at it i ment: It's a whole raosted boar, replete with a decorative arro ing its bloated stomach and tiny broiled baby bores place it as if they were suckling on their well-cooked mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing) My god, sort of grusome, isn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the meat being served, Indiana looks across the ta Blumburtt who seems equally puzzled.  Meanwhile, the litt rajah whispers to his Prime Minsiter.  Then Chattar Lal s the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Highness wants me to welcome his visitors.  Especially the renowned Dr. Jones from America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy bows slightly toward the Maharajah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are honored to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants put down another platter.  Willie stares at an e steaming boa constrictor on the platter.  With a flash of knife, a servant slits the huge snake and exposes a mass squirming, live baby eels inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly I'm not so hungry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Indiana is chatting poleitely with the Prime M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a question, Mr. Prime Mini- ster.  I was examining some of the Maharajah's artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very fine collection of very old pieces, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very fine.  But not all of the pieces look old.  Some were carved recently and look like images used by the Thuggees to worship the god- des Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the emntion of the Thuggees, the Indians at the table as it a taboo has been broken.  Chattar Lal glares at Ind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones, you know very well that the Thuggee cult has been dead for nearly a century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  The Thuggees were an obscenity that worshipped Kali with human sacrifices.  The Brit- ish Army wiped them out about the time of the Mutiny of 1857.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round avoids the dinner by feeding it to his little as he listens to the scary conversation. The talk is bad enough, but Willie finds the food unbelie A servant leans overher shoulder and places a six-inch lo on her plate! Willie whimpers quietly as she watches the fat merchant n her lift one of the black, shiny baked-beetles -- and cra two!  The man proceeds to enthusiastically suck the gooey out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Willie) But you're not eating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) I uh -- had bugs for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Indiana continues to politely needle Chattar L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose stories of the Thuggees die hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no stories anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know... we came here from a small village and the peas- ants there told us that the Pankot Palace was growing powerful again -- becuase of some ancient evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana smiles and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneeringly) Their stories are just fear and folklore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cooly)  Maybe.. but how do you explain The Thuggee shrine I saw right below the palace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy catches a glance between the little Maharajah and th minister, who answers slowly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The local peasants are just as superstitious.  You're very ob- servant, Dr. Jones.  But you're beginning to worry Capt. Blum- burtt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blumburtt's phlegmatic attitude has changed to curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried, Prime Minister, just interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During their conversation, Willie listens to beetles SNAP she watches revolted as the other dinner guests suck the insides out of the bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Short Round) Give me your hat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to puke in it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Indy continues ingenously with Chattar Lal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the villagers also claimed that this palace stole something from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones, it our country a guest does not usually insult his host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought we were just talking about folklore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make peace) I'm sure it's nothing.  Just ru- mors. (but interested) What was it they claimed was stolen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something magical.  A sacred rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (condescendingly) There, you see, Captain.  A rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they lost this rock their fields and animals dies.  They also said their children were taken from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's enough  of this nonsense, Dr. Jones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana smiles faintly at Chattar Lal's anger.  Across th Willie looks pale and motions to the waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have something, you know, simple -- like soup or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The servant goes off and returns with a covered bowl.  He ers it and Willie looks at a soup with a dozen eyeballs f in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks delicious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie whimpers and tears start down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chattar Lal) I was dubious muself at first. Then something connected -- the village's rock and the old legend of the Sankara Stones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlling himself) Dr. Jones, we are all vulnerable to vicious rumors.  I seem to re- member that in Honduras you were accused of being a grave robber rather than a scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) The newspapers exaggerated the incident

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And didn't the Sultan of Madagas- car threaten to cut your head off if you ever returned to his coun- try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Exactly what we have here, Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard the terrible stories of the evil Thuggee cult...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the little Marahajah speaks it surprises everyone an is silence. MAHARAJAH (Cont'd) I thought the stories were told to frighten children.  Later, I learned that the Thuggee cult was once real and did unspeakable things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marahajah looks at Indiana. MAHARAJAH (Cont'd) I am ashamed of what happened here so many years ago.  We keep these objects -- to remind us that this will never again happen in my kingdom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) I'm sorry if I've offended you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, more trays are whisked in by servants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, dessert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round's monkey suddenly screeches and takes off.  W closed here eyes in dread - but curiosity gets the best o and she looks -- it's worse than she could imagine: Plates full of small, dead monkey heads!  (*Production no cause of his extremely sensitive nature, the director has ted that these monkey heads be simulated). The tops of the monkey's skulls have been cut off and sit like little covers.  Willie watches in utter dismay as th rajah and his guests remove the skull-tops and start dipp spoons into what's inside -- MERCHANT (Cont'd) Chilled monkey brains!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie keels over, crashing backwards in a dead faint!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women servants help a woobly-kneed Willie toward her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of lanters illuminate the garden where after din drinks are served, cigars lighted and hookah pipes puffed Indiana comes out of the pavilion into the garden with Ca Blumburtt and they talk quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather bizarre menu, woundn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if they were trying to scare us away, a devout Hindu would never touch meat. (looking around) Makes you wonder what these people are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the little Maharajah comes over with his retinue and reaches for Indy's whip which Short Round is carrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen this thing.  What is it, Dr. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, nobody touches Indy's whip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round grabs for it, but Indiana restrains him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're guests here, Shorty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maharajah glares are Short Round and five the whip to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will show me how it works please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy bows to the little prince and smiles ironically --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish is my command, your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Short Round watches angrily, Indiana walks across t den and unfurls the whip.  Indy sees a servant lighting a Suddenly the whip flies and CRACKS like a pistol shot.  T candle disappears!  Indiana whirls and CRACKS the whip ag snagging a flower out of a dancing girl's hair. The Maharajah reacts like any kid -- he shoops happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is wonderful!  Please teach me how!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round sulks as he listens to Indiana instructing th rajah on how to hold the whip.  As the young prince pract grip, Indy notices Chattar Lal slip behind a fountain to a dark figure in robes who appears. Indiana sees Chattar Lal bow to the dark figure -- and In catches a glimpse of the stranger's pale face and dark ho eyes.  Then the robled apparition seems to disappear. Meanwhile everyone watches respectfully as the Maharajah the whip for his first attempt.  He flings the whip but i back and snaps  -- biting his own  cheek. There's a stunned silence -- then Short Round laughs  at little prince who is holding his wounded cheek.  The ince rahajah suddenly flashes the whip as Short Round. Short Round grabs the end of it and pulls hard -- the whi tugged taut between the two hostile boys.  As they draw n other, Short Round sees something weird: The little Maharajah's eyes begin glowing yelloe and he h softly in a strange voice.  Nobody else sees or hears the transformation... Indiana finally intercedes -- he grabs Short Round by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Short Round, let go of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round lets go and Indy gently takes the whip back f little prince. INDIANA (Cont'd) The Turks say that a whip can be an enemy even to its owner.  If you get some rope, it'll be easier to learn with, your Highness. Now, I think we'll say goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maharajah and Short Round stare hostiley at each othe Indy recoils his whip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round walks beside Indiana down the shadowy hall to their room.  Short Round has Indy's whip curled around hi der.  The little fellow yawns and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little Maharajah think he big stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like him do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I flatten him!  Did you see his eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, they glow like fire and get real crazy!  Then he talk in this real scary voice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy tousles Short Round's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was afraid of you.  He knows a tough  guy when he sees one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not so shure) Yeah, that's what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach their room and Short Round opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better see how Willie is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round shakes his head scornfully as Indy crosses th and knocks on another door.  After a moment, the door ope Willie is standing there in a tempting nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up something wrapped in a piece of silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Not leftovers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- real food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie opens the bundle suspiciously -- then her hace lig as she examines the breads and fruits inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it is real food...it's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bites happily into a piece of fruit -- its juice runs her chin and Indy wipes it off gently with his hand.  The deliberately seductive and Willie is not displeased. WILLIE (Cont'd) You're nice.  Listen, I'm taking applications -- how'd you like to be my palace slave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Wearing your jewels to be, prin- cess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy touches her necklace -- then his hand caresses her n ear.  She shivers slightly and speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- and nothing else. (smiling) That shock you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I'm a scientist.  I like doing research on certain "nocturnal activities" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and puts a grape to his lips.  He opens his mo takes it and chews it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like love rituals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows the grape and they move toward each other slo kiss, revealing the passion that's simmering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mating customs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again more heatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primitive sexual practices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taling to an authority in that area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again hungrily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dying to come into my room, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're too used to get- ting you own way, Willie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss yet again -- and Indy breaks it off, just to sh still in control.  He backs away toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching him) We'll see who gives in first -- I'll leave my door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't catch cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jones -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stops by his door and sees Willie smiling as she hol five fingers -- WILLIE (Cont'd) Five minutes... you'll be back over here in five minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dreaming, Willie.  You want to make it real, just knock on my door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks.  She waves.  But neither one will surrender fir Willie does into her room, leaving the door ajar.  Indy o door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy comes in and closes the door -- leaving it open a cr stands and listens, waiting for her to come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie stands likewise by her door, waiting to hear Indy back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana shrugs and walks over to a couch and starts takin his tweed jacket and necktie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes... fat chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie moves around her lavish suite, turning down lights a romantic effect, checking herself in a mirror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently) Five minutes, Dr. Jones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy undresses in the magnificently decorated room:  wall ings show palace scenes and landscapes; life-size figures dance and there are full-scale portraits or Rajput prince prancing horses.  But Indy's more concerned with lust tha art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) ...want me to be her palace slave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his whip and smiles, considering using it on Then he just grubles and tosses the bullwhip onto the cou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying in bed in a seductive pose, Willie waits for Indy t up and she starts to look worried.  She grabs a clock and it to see if it's working.  She taps her fingers irritabl dering in her charm has failed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see another clock ticking.  Looking annoyed, Indy toss boot at it and the clock falls on its face, setting of th alarm. On the chaise lounge in front of Indy's bed, Short Round groggily and sees Indy turning off the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half asleep) Get to sleep Indy -- I stay up and keep eye on things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Shorty ... see you in the morning...I'm going to have a little -- word with Willie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy finally shakes his head and gives in to his animal instincts.  He buttons his shirt, puts his boots back on grabs his leather jacket. As he puts on his jacket he walks past the life-sized pai armed gaurds standing in silent vigil.  Suddenly we see s frightening behind him:  one of the wall paintings sees t to life! A large figure in robes and a turban looms out from the w lifts a silk cord -- the figure wraps the cord suddenly a Indiana's neck! The huge assassin stands behind Indy, twisting the cord e tighter around his neck.  As Indy attempts to break free sees the assassin's face is a mirror -- and a strange yel light glowing in the killer's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie's finally had enough waiting and she gets out of b lantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming...I can't be- lieve it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across the room and opens the door.  She looks the empty hall -- and her resolve starts to weaken -- WILLIE (Cont'd) Well... (bracing herself) No!  I'm not going over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes back into her room and kicks the door closed. WILLIE (Cont'd) Sleep tight, Dr. Jones! (suddenly melancholy) I could've been your greatest ad- venture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy shoves the assassin backwards, ramming the big man i wall.  The assassin maintains his deathgrip -- while on t chaise, Short Round sleeps through it all! Gasping futilely for air, Indy sinks slowly to his knees eyes bulge and he stares at the tiny, smiling skulls at t of the death-cord wrapped around the assassin's fists. Indiana sinks lower and then feels something -- desperate grabs a brass pot on the floor by the handle and swings i his last strength, smashing it up into the assassin's hea a skull-crushing clang! The assassin is stunned and Indiana curls forward pulling into a somersault and sening him flying over his back.  T assin crashes on his sping next to the chaise.  Short Rou doesn't wake up. Indiana rips the cord from around his neck and gasps for He sees the assassin pulling a knife.  Indiana dives as t flies through the air and slams into the wall. Indiana grabs his whip, rolls and lands on his feet.  As assin tries to retreat, Indy unleashes his whip -- it CRA wraps around the killer's neck. The big man struggles, pulling on the whip, trying to rel from his throat -- and Indiana holds fast, watching the k gasping for air now as his face turns red. Suddenly the assassin does a full-blown backward sommersa which rips the whip out of Indy's hand.  The assassin has stant to grin victoriously -- Until he sees that the whip handle is arching toward the where is gets caught on the revolving fan!  The surprised in it tugged upwards -- and the whip twists around the ce fan like fishing-line around a fishing-reel-- And like a doomed flounder, the assassin is slowly reeled dragged toward the ceiling, his toes lifting off the floo The assassin screams as he is hanged!  His legs twitch in his death throes -- and below him, Short Round finally wa Always Indiana's protector, Shorty instictively leaps off couch and draws a small dagger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Indy!  Where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round spins a 360 , then looks up and does a double seeing the dead assassin twisting slowly around the ceili Indy takes Short Rund by the shoulders and turns him away the grisly sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's over -- go turn off the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short goes over and turns off the fan -- the assassin's b drops and Indy recoils his whip.  Suddenly they hear a hi scream -- Willie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a tight close-up:  Willie screams again.  She's lying looking down at something -- Moving up her shapely leg, a green and black, monstrous-l insect crawls onto her stomach and Willie stops breather. bilized by fear, Willie watches in silent agony as the hi insect climbs slowly up her breast and slithers toward he Across the suite, the doors burst open and Indiana rushes Shorty is behind him, carrying Indy's whip.  Indiana leap stools and slides up to the bed to save WIllie -- Then he spots the giant insect crawling on her and decide have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This a cheap trick to get me over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie speaks with desperate, fearful precision --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- don't you see -- crawling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- the bug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie is petrified and shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get -- the -- bug -- off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I wouldn't want to touch an ugly critter like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Uh uh -- me neither!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks at the man-of-action like he's insane.  Then feels the bug crawling onto her cheek --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no -- oh no!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the bug) You know, Willie, I'll bet he's mad because they were eating his friends for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- oh please, I'm going to die!  Get it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana shrugs and leans over and casually swats the horr off her face.  He and Short Round watch the insect skid a the floor -- and suddenly disappear as if by magic! Puzzled, they wander toward the wall, leaving Willie behi bathed in sweat, staring at the ceiling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do to deserve this trip?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneeling by the wall, Short Round examines the baseboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went under.  Hey, I feel wind, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana knocks on the wall and considers the hollow sound moves back and looks at the whole wall.  Behind him, Will past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm packing!  I'm getting out of here right now tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dashes behind a screen to start getting dressed.  Mea Indy feels the marble walls.  He moves to a niche in whic is a small statue of Ganesha, the friendly elephant god. Indiana lifts the statue -- and a panel in the wall opens ly.  Short Round looks amazed.  Indy watches the light fa across the far wall of a tunnel as the door opens slowly. Indy peers into the tunnel at an old wall painting.  Spid skrit calligraphy runs under a flanking illustration of a bowing before a god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *(He reads aloud an inscription in Sanskrit).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean, Indy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) "Follow in the footsteps of Shiva.  Do not betray his truth."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy takes out the piece of cloth the boy gave him in May the similarities are striking.  It is also a picture of S Sankara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *(He repeats aloud the inscrip- tion also written on the cloth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over behind the screen, Willie's getting into some silk p an Indian-style brocade bodice top --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if I have to walk to Delhi, I'm -- hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices Indy and Short Round bending to enter the dar behind the wall. WILLIE (Cont'd) Wait a minute!  What're you -- where're you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy pokes his head back into the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock your door and don't leave until we get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears behind the wall and Willie looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Short Round enter the secret passage and move fo slowly into the inky darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we suppose to be in here, Indy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They creep slowly down the dark tunnel.  It grows smaller ducks his head. SHORT ROUND (Cont'd) I step on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their footsteps crunch on the tunnel floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, there's something all over the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Short Round has to duck and Indy finally kneels to h hands and knees. INDIANA (Cont'd) We'll have to crawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they crawl, their hands and knees continue to crunch o ever it is littering the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, the floor -- there is some- thing alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana gets a match out of his pocket.  He snaps it with thumb and the match flares -- a hideous insectarium: a li collection of the world's ugliest antropods, hexapods and nids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy smoke -- I'm scared, Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana turns and sees something else --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a chamber here.  Come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy finds an oil lamp on the wall and lights it.  Short happily scampers into the chamber and Indy follows him. the door slides shut -- trapping them inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana lights a match and finds another oil lamp.  He an Round look for a way to open the door that closed behind but they have no luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they hear Willie's voice echoing down the short tunn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the suite, Willie stands by the entrance to the s passage, peering into the dark tunnel -- WILLIE (Cont'd) Indiana Jones?!  Are you in there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy mutters irritably to himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we're in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks everywhere for something to open the door.  Shor Round spots a loose brick and moves it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, I found a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly they hear a rumble and Indy turns to see the opp wall moving -- the spikes start appearing!  Their lethal protrude from the wall as it starts closing in toward Ind Short Round. SHORT ROUND (Cont'd) Indy -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty points up and Indiana sees more spikes descending ceiling!  Indy turns toward the door and shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- Willie?! (louder) Willie, you better get down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie listens and looks scared --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, come here!  Hurry up, we're in trouble!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, help!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie is frightened, confused and jumping around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deadly spikes inch slowly toward them from the wall a ing.  They start pounding on the door and shout --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, damn it!  Get down here, NOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie finds the courage to finally whimper and step into dark passage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell -- I bet I get all dirty again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie starts down the dark tunnel toward the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming, what's the rush?! Ohh!  What's that?!  There's stuff all over the floor!  I can't see a thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear her coming and Indy watches nervously as the sp draw even closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, Willie!  Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie crawls and crunches on the littered floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all wet and icky!  Aaahh -- things are moving!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the low lamp by the door to the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Willie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the lamp and turns it up so it burns brighter. looks around -- and SCREAMS!!  She sees the sickening, sw mass of glistening insects crawling toward her, attracted light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) There's bugs!  Bugs all over! Help!  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, open the door!  GET US OUT OF HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie pounds on the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN THE DOOR!  LET ME IN!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spikes close in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET US OUT!  Willie, shut up and listen!  There's got to be a ful- crum release!  Look around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie whines and frantically searches the wall.  Insects crawling and jumping on her and she kicks at them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fulcrum release lever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find any lever!  Help me Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Short Round are backed against the wall and t spikes are a foot away and moving in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around, Willie!  There's got to be a liever hidden somewhere!  Come on, you can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insects drop onto Willie from the ceiling and fly at her flattens against the wall.  Then her elbow hits something loose stone.  She claws at it and it falls out of the wal leaving a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hole!  I found a square hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it -- the release lever -- look inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am -- it looks horrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hole is revolting :  covered with squirming insects, oozes some kind of glistening mucus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reach inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie moves her hand toward the nauseating hole then pul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Indy!  I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana turns his head sideways and sucks in his breath, deadly spikes are poking into his leater jacket now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lever!  Willie, do it!  NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie screams and jams her hand into the gross hole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, it's soft -- it's moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round is frightened to death and crying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, help us!  Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears Short Round crying and twists her hand in the d ing hole.  Suddenly the door springs open!  Willie pulls out and stares in horror -- her hand and arm are covered greenish slimey mung!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spikes suddenly retract, disappearing into the wall a ing.  Indy pulls Willie inside the chamber and the door s shut again.  Willie dances around, yelling about the hide on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get is off me -- get it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy helps her wipe it off.  Willie falls back against th WILLIE (Cont'd) You left me out there!  What in the hell were you doing in here?! I want to leave this place right now!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the same lever that Short Round pulled earlier a for it.  Indiana dives and manages to stop her from activ the spikes agian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that one!  We had enought of that one, thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around and spots a small rock protruding from th Cautiously, praying htat it won't activate another booby Indy pushes the rock. A large door opens on the other side of the chamber -- a wind howls past outside the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana, Short Round and Willie exit the spike chamber an down a larger tunnel through which a roaring wind intermi blows, howling eerily like a note of gloomy music. Indiana follows a curve in the tunnel and they see light The wind holws another dramatic note which gales past the they reach the mouth of the tunnel. Indiana is joined by Willie and Short Round.  They all st astonishment at the sight below them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the camera pulls back,  the mouth of the wind tunnel i they are standing becomes just a small hole overlooking t gering vastness of the incredible TEMPLE OF DEATH. The colossal subterranean temple has been carved out of a mass of rock.  A vaulting cathedral-like ceiling is suppo rows of carved stone columns. Balconies overlook the temple floor.  Pillared halls lead dark side chambers.  Moving out of these chambers, hundre faithful worshippers chant as they enter the temple. Mammoth stone statues of elephants, lions and demi-gods ( half/animal monstrosities) loom above the swelling crowds shippers. As the wind howls out of the tunnel high above the temple worshippers chant in response to the strange tunnel music

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moaning wind rushes past Indiana, Willie and Short Ro they watch the mystery cult below bowing toward an enormo at the far end of the temple. This altar is a platform jutting out from the stone wall cavern.  Separating the worshippers from this altar is a crevasse out of which wisps of smoke rise occasionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the crevasse, evil-looking priests materialize out of clouds of swirling smoke.  The priests smoke-billowing urns to a giant stone statue. Now, we see the hideous protectress of the temple, the ob malevolent ombect of the cult's devotion:  the bloodthirs dess KALI! The red-eyed priests bow at the base of the statue and ga reverently at their KALI MA.  Skulls surround her stone f carved serpents twist up her legs, while around her waist is a guresome belt of human hands. Naked to the hips, Kali's hair falls about her four arms. hand, she holds a sword, in the second the severed head o giant.With her other hands she encourages her worshipers, are chanting louder and louder! Kali's face is loathsome:  her earrings are two corpses. evil tongue extends out of her twisted mouth and what loo read blood flows over her long fangs and down her naked b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from the high opening, Willie looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Thuggee ceremony.  They're whorshipping Kali, the goddess of Death and Destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge drum sounds three times and the chanting stops.  T silence is chilling as another robed figure appears out o some on the altar. This is MOLA RAM, the High Priest of the Thugge cult.  Mo Ram's red-rimmed eyes glare from the sunken sockets in hi sinister face.  Here is a man who looks as vile and diabo as the unholy goddess rising behind him. Up in the wind tunnel, Indy stares down at the High Pries realizes that is was Mola Ram he saw conferring with Chat in the palace garden. As the drum booms three times more, Mola Ram lifts one ar up from his emaciated body and suddenly there is a scream All heads turn toward an unfortunate, struggling Indian b dragged out by priests.  The man's face and body are wild painted.  He screams again as he's tied onto a square iro laying atop a large flat stone. Mola Ram steps forward to the stretched-out victim and th looks up into the High Priest's grotesque face -- Suddenly Mola Ram's hand shoots out toward the man's ches pierces it!  The High Priests hand sinks into the victim' writing body and rips out his living heart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie covers her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  He ripped out his -- he killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...the heart's still beating!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, the bloody heart is still beating in Mola Ram's h He lifts the heart into the air and the worhippers begin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jai ma Kali, jai ma Kali!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stranger still, the sacrificial victim is still alive -- no evidence of a gash on his chest, only a reddish mark priests add chains to the iron frame and carry the victim toward a hoist hanging over the crevasse. The man thrashes about helplessly on the iron frame as it ended and then lowered with the victim hanging face down As the sacrificial victim looks down into the crevasse be he screams -- and we see the molten lava bubbling crimson bottom of the chasm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie closes her eyes but Indy and Short Round watch hor as the iron frame is lowered -- and the bloody heart cont beat in Mola Ram's hand -- and the molten lava burns and as the screaming victim is lowered deeper into the crevas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weird paint on the victim's face starts to smoke and the man's skin blisters as he's lowered within feet of th lava.  His flesh smokes and he screams one last time as h bursts into flame. The iron frame sinks and submerges into the boiling fiery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the crevasse, Mola Ram continues to hold the heart his hand -- the heart is smoking and bursts into flames - disappears!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iron frame is raised out of the lava -- the metal glo like a branding iron, but there is no trace of the sacrif victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the wind howls again, Willie and Short Round look sick appalled by the ceremony.  Even Indy seems shaken by what are witnessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jai ma Kali,  jai ma Kali!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moal Ram raises both hands and his voice echoes strange i tions.  Behind him, three priests carry cloth-wrapped obj ward the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie is crying and her voice is shoking as she turns aw the hideous ritual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!  Let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priests reverently unwrap three conical pieces of crystallized quartz.  The place the three stones below th tue of Kali and slowly the smoke around the altar swirls The smoke is drawn to the three stones and they actually haling the piraling smoke.  The smoke disappears into the and the air clears.  Then the three stones start to glow haunting incandescent white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round looks scared.  Willie is still crying -- Indy horrified but fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village knew their rock was magic -- but they didn't know it was one of the lost Sankara Stones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why they glow like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend says that when the stones are brought together the diamonds inside of them will glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie wipes her eyes and becomes more interested --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamonds...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sankara Stones shimmer brightly, and inside the cryst quartz, the enormous sparkling diamonds of legend are now vealed. Mola Ram stands facing Kali with his arms outstretched an kneels and bows and then walks off the altar and disappea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana sees the woshippers below start to leave the temp looks at Willie and Short Round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- now listen -- you wait here and keep quiet.  Shorty, keep an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round nods and hands Indy his bullwhip and shoulder Willie sees Indiana peering down at the sheer drop below mouth of the wind tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down?  Down there?!  Are you crazy --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving without those stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her) Maybe...someday. (smiling) Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep my eye peeled, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana nods and looks down at the now empty temple.  The slips down from the mouth of the wind tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana skillfully clumbs down an enormous tmeple column ing footholds on stone cobras, carved lions and the stone of dancing girls.  Slowly, he makes his way down and swin a balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana walks quietly along the balcony overlooking the t He stops -- between him and the altar is the crevasse wit lava bubbling fire at the bottom. Indiana looks across the gulf and sees another column nea altar at the top of which stone elephants are perched.  I curls his whip and suddenly lets it fly -- The whip cracks and its end wraps tightly around the tusk of the stone elephants.  From the balcony, Indy tugs the taut, takes a breath and runs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana leaps and swings out on the whip, arching down an over the chasm of fiery lava in a spectacular curving jum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy lands on his feet and turns to release the whip.  Sh Round waves to Indy that the coast is clear.  Indy snaps -- it releases from the elephant tusk and drops. Recurling the whip, Indy attaches it to his belt and move ward the towering statue of Kali.  The three Sankara ston to glow and Indiana approaches them cautiously. Reaching the stones, Indy's face is lighted by them.  He that one of them (sthe stone from Mayapore village) has s lines painted across it. Suspiciously, Indy touches the stone, but it doesn't burn lifts it carefully and peers into it.  The enormous diamo sparkles inside.  He places the stone in his shoulder bag reaches for the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round and Willie watch apprehensively as Indiana ba three stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana backs away and looks up at the horrific statue of It seems to be watching him.  He turns and is about to go hears something -- It sounds like a voice and Indy is afraid to turn -- coul Kali?  The he hears other noises echoing and turns slowly alizing the sounds are coming from behind the altar, Indy around it toward the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round and Willie are mystified as they see Indiana pear behind the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell, where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round looks worried.  Then the wind rushes past the and howls its somber musical note.  However, the wind sou ferent this time, its tone quavering slightly. Short Round is puzzled and looks around.  He  feeezes whe two shadowy figures coming down the tunnel toward them -- bodies causing the tone of the wind to shift eerily -- Willie notices Short Round pulling a dagger from his belt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she turns and screams as two huge Thuggee guards at them!  One grabs at Short Round but the kid slashes th guard's hand with his dagger. Willie tries to get past the other guard, but he snatches the arm and pulls her toward him -- from her training at lege of Hard Knocks, Willie successfully knees the big ma balls. WILLIE (Cont'd) Keep your paws off, letch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man groans and sinks to his knees.  Willie sees that Round is in trouble.  She runs over, leaps onto the back other guard and starts ripping his hair out. Short Round picks up his fallen dagger.  The big guard lu backwards and smashes Willie into the rocky wall of the t Willie falls to the floor. Short Round approaches, holding the man at bay with his d Willie turns as the other guard, the one she kneed, crawl her -- Willie scoops up some dirt and throws it.  The man at his eyes and Willie jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run Willie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie starts to run and Short Round backs away, keeping guard at a distance with his dagger.  Suddenly the guard in Hindi and dives at Short Round. Panicking, Shorty tries to run after Willie -- but he's t The guard has Short Round by the foot and drags him back. looks around and stops running.  She sees Short Round is SHORT ROUND (Cont'd) No!  Run!  Go get help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie hesitates, then runs down the tunnel.  Meanwhile, moth hand clutches Short Round's throat -- the giant guar Shorty completely off the ground and the kid looks terrif helpless as he dangles in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana enters the dark chamber behind the altar.  The on lumination is the back-light streaming around the silhoue statue of Kali. Indy slowly crosses a narrow stone bridge and moves towar lindrical shaft of light rising up from what appears to b enormous hole. Indy hears voices and the clink of metal against rock as tinues forward.  The ground is dark in front of the large He edges toward the precipice and the light rising up ill the look of shock on his face as he peers down into Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks into a deep pit around which concentric paths into numerous narrow tunnels.  Crawling out of these burr scrawny children drag sacks of dirt and rock.  Other holl children pull these sacks to mine cars waiting on rails. Straining to lift the rocks into the mine cars, several o children slip and fall.  Bare-chested Thuggee guards shou enslaves children and kick those who've fallen. For these children there would seem to be only one hope - -- an end to their travail. Indiana edges around the hole, looking into the ghastly m feeling as if he's discovered an inferno of misery as gro as Dante's. Indy shifts the bag of stones on his shoulder.  He hesita considers his choice:  he has the Sankara Stones and can with them now... But Indy hears the pleading cries of one child and peers see a burly Thuggee guard beating the pitiful little slav gets angrier and angrier as he watches. He finally steps over the grabs a boulder.  He lifts it a flings it down into the mine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Indiana above and the boulder hurtling down -- it onto the head of the Thuggee guard who hits the ground li sack of cement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy sees the startled slave children looking up at him i He smiles victoriously at the Thuggees below who've run o see what happened. Indy's smile seems to fade as his anger turns to surprise feels something unnerving: Dirt is crumbling away from the rim of the hole, a small landslide starting beneath his feet.  Suddenly the floor way and Indy slips! The entire rim of the hole shears off and Indy topples wi and plunges down into the mine toward the assembled guard scatter -- Indy yells as he falls and it echoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana's yell continues to echo -- his head jerks sudden Indy jolts awake as if coming out of a nightmare, awakene own reverberating shout. Indy is lying on the rocky floor of a dark cave/cell.  He his hands and discovers that they are chained.  In the mu light, he sees Short Round sitting in chains across the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy -- you knocked out when you fall.  You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana nods groggily.  He sees a young slave worker in r ting near Short Round.  Through the iron bars of the cell sees the children slaving in the mine tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the kid) This is Nainsukh -- from the vil- lage.  They bring him here to dig in the mines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children are small -- we can work in tunnels.  Now I am too old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What they do to you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pray to Shiva -- let me die. But I do not.  Now -- now the evil of Kali take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will make me drink blood of Kali.  Then I fall into black sleep of Kali Ma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I become like them.  I be  alive -- nut like in nightmare.  You drink the blood, you not wake up from nightmare of Kali Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a noise and they see two guards and a priest outs cell.  Nainsukh cowers in the darkness at the back of the like a trapped animal awaiting the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Short Round are pushed down a tunnel by guard are stopped at a door and shoved inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana and Short Round stumble into the chamber.  It is fying gallery of occult yantras, ritualistic statues and icons of the evil Thuggee sect. Grotesque statues of Kali's baleful minions line the wall corner, there is another statue of Kali herself, draped w flowers, necklaces of real human skills and slithering be live snakes. Fresh blood has been splashed over the statue and at its the three Sankara Stones recovered from Indiana.  Mola Ra in a yoga position near the statue of Kali. Mola Ram opens his eyes and he sees Indiana and Short Rou standing in chains before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were caught trying to steal the Sankara Stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Nobody's perfect.  The way I heard it, you stole one of them from a small village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mola Ram stands and gazes transfixed at the stones glowin altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were five stones in the beginning.  Over the centuries they were dispersed by wars, sold off by thieves like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two are still missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They are here -- somewhere. A century ago when the British raided this temple and butchered my people, a loyal priest his the last two stones down here in the catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you've got these chil- dren -- these slaves digging for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig for the gems to support our cause.  They also search for the last two stones.  Soon we will have all five Sankara Stones and the Thuggees will be all powerful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody can say you don't have a vivid imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not believe me?  You will, Dr. Jones.  You will become a true believer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Mola Ram bows slightly as the little M enters.  Indy looks surprised and Short Round tenses. MOLA RAM (Cont'd) Your Highness will witness the thief's conversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mola Ram nods and two guards grab Indy.  They drag him st to a rock and chain him to it.  Short Round scuffles as h pulled aside to watch. Remembering the High Priest's earlier open-heart surgery, ana looks worried as Mola Ram approaches him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not suffer.  I recently became of age and tasted the blood of Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the young initiate comes forward and Indiana looks st it's Nainsukh.  He is wearing robes and his eyes are glow strangely.  Nainsukh hands Mola Ram a hollow human skull blood! The guards hold Indiana's head back and force his mouth o Mola Ram tips the skull and blood spills out of its death grinning jaws and flows into Indiana's mouth.  Indy gags Suddenly he spits the blood, spraying Mola Ram and the li Maharajah.  Looking at his blood-splattered clothes, the jah is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little prince's eyes glow angrily and he hisses at In

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will learn to obey because you are powerless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little Maharajah pulls a small krtya from his robes - sees that the doll has been crudely fashioned to resemble MAHARAJAH (Cont'd) I control you now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maharajah turns and sticks the doll into a flaming ur diana suddenly cries out and twists in pain as he is burn little prince smiles evilly and puts the doll back into h robes. Then he goes over to where Indy's whip and bag have been He grabs the bullwhip. MAHARAJAH (Cont'd) You told me that a whip could be an enemy to its owner.  We shall see!  Turn him over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guards turn Indy face down, they rip off his jacke chain his ahnds to the rock.  The Maharajah uncurls the w notices Short Round smiling snidely -- Suddenly the Maharajah cracks the whip -- it lashes out a into Short Round's shoulder.  Blood appears and Short Rou stunned by the lash and by the fact the Marahajah knows w use the whip. MAHARAJAH (Cont'd) As Dr. Jones suggested, I have been practicing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little Maharajah whirls and lashes the whip again.  I jerks as the bullwhip rips through his shirt and tears op flesh.  The Maharajah lashes again and again -- blood spu across Indy's tattered shirt. As the whipping continues- Short Round jumps as if he is ing beaten.  His eyes fill with tears as he watches Indy Finally, the little Maharajah lets the whip fall limp.  A Maharajah approaches Indy, Short Round lunges as him angr the guards restrain him. Indiana groans as he's turned over.  Blood trickles from mouth and he stares up hatefully at Mola Ram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The British in India will be slaughtered.  Then we will over- run the Moslems and force their "Allah" to bow to Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mola Ram is once again given the human skull by a priest lifts it toward Indy's face -- MOLA RAM (Cont'd) And then the Hebrew God will fall and finally the Christian God will be cast down and forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's head is held back and Mola Ram spills the blood -- flows out of the mouth of the skull into Indy's mouth. MOLA RAM (Cont'd) Soon Kali Ma will rule the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy's eyes look horrified as the blood flows from the sk his choking throat -- some of the blood spills and falls floor -- We see the very earth trembling as the evil spreads -- a appears beneath Indy's feet and a small line of crimson l oozes out and smiles evilly across the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diaphanous curtains billow silently into the moonlighted Two exotic birds sit on a golden perch, their eyes clicki watchfully.  Suddenly the brids shriek and flap away -- Willie stumbles through the secret door and falls into th Insects cover her and she shimpers as she knocks them off manages to stagger to her feet and she heads for the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie rushes out of her room and runs through the desert ace looking for help.  She flies down the moonlit corrido the huge wall paintings. She stops by a courtyard and calls out desperately, but t no one around.  She backs away down a hallway and then ju seeing something in a mirror:  a face looms behind her an screams! Willie whirls and sees Chattar Lal, the Prime Minister, a ing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you scared me!  Listen, you've got to help.  We found this tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Blumburtt comes around a corner and interrupts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chattar Lal) Jones isn't in his room.  Miss Scott -- my troops are leaving at dawn if you want us to escort you to Delhi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- you can't go!  Something aw- ful's happened.  They've got Short Round and I think Indy's been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found a tennel that leads to a temple below the palace!  Please, come with me, I'll show you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men exchange dubious looks.  Willie grabs Blumbur the arm and they start down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Scott, you're not making any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid they'll kill them!  We saw horrible things down there -- they had a human sacrifice and they ripped a man's heart out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some kind of cult!  And they've got the sacred stones that Indy was searching for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sense the fumes of opium in all this.  Prehaps Miss Scott picked up the habit in Shanghai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about -- I'm not a dope fiend!  I saw it!  I'll show you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them into her suite.  Willie points to the dark in the wall.  Blumburtt picks up an oil lamp and holds it the opening -- suddenly he jumps back as Indiana emerges!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling faintly) What're we playing, hid and seek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all startled.  Willie looks relieved and rushes o Indy and puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Indy, you got away!  Tell them what happened, they won't believe me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her and feels her trembling from anger.  He walks her to the bed and helps her sit down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  You're all right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think I'm insane.  Tell them I'm not, Indy.  Please -- help me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The awful events have taken their toll and Willie covers and cries like a scared kid.  Indy gets her to lie down o bed.  He sits beside her and smiles and touches her hair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I thought you were supposed to be a real tropper.  Willie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wipes the tears from her face and she holds his hand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to go to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I want to go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you... this hasn't been what you'd call a fun vaca- tion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles a little despite herself and he touches her ch He eyes are already closing and he stands up. A servant is entering the suite to take care of Willie. sers her with a blanket and start dropping the mosquito n as Indy walks off toward the verandah with Blumburtt and Lal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first light is breaking over the mountain peaks.  Com onto the verandah, Indy and the other two men see the cav troops breaking camp below and readying their horses and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent by life crawling around in caves and tunnels -- I shouldn't have let somebody like Willie go in there with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Scott panicked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she saw the insects she passed out cold.  I carried her back to her room.  She was sleeping when I re-entered the tunnel to look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she slept, she undoubtedly had nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana looks at him and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she must have run out of the room and you found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you discover anything in that tunnel, Dr. Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana stares into the rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Just a dead end.  That tunnel's been deserted for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sergeant-major shouts up to Blumburtt that the troops a ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Prime Minister, my re- port will duly note that we found nothing unusual here in Pankot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that will please the Maharajah, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Indiana) As I said before, we'd be happy to escort you to Delhi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I don't think Willie is ready to travel yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust swirls as the British cavalry moves off with their H Pipers at the head playing a military bagpipe tune.  Capt burtt comes out of the palace and gets into an open car. Blumburtt's car moves off behind the cavalry and then the trucks follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whine of the bagpipes is eerily muted in the dark roo Through the gently swaying mosquito netting, we see Willi on the bed. Then through her side of the gauzy netting, we see the do opening across the room.  Indiana enters quietly and move the bed, his eyes fixed on Willie's sleeping body. Indy sits down on the bed slowly.  Willie turns in her sl opens her eyes.  Through the mosquito netting she sees In ting with his back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy?  Did you walk to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now they believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana speaks in a strange monotone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they'll send the soldiers down into the temple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks at Indiana's back and continues quietly. WILLIE (Cont'd) I was scared to death last night when I thought they were going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... they won't kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling faintly) You know you've been nothing but trouble since I hooked up with you -- but I have to admit I'd miss you if I lost you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Indiana starts to turn slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't lose me, Willie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees him turn and his face slowly comes toward the mo netting -- his face pushes into the netting and Willie lo stunned as Indy's mouth opens -- He starts hissing grotesquely, smoke billows out of his m the mosquito netting BURNS OPEN to expose his terrifying moving toward Willie -- She is forzen with fear and unable to utter a sound as In malevolent face looms at her -- and then she notices his his eyes glowing a hellish luminscent yellow! Willie SCREAMS!! She suddenly bolts from the bed and tries to run -- India into a rage, ripping the mosquito netting from the bed as lows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I've found it -- you can't -- Kali knows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie tries the door but it's locked.  She sees Indiana toward her ranting incoherently as he smashes a vase out way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- been too many lies -- there's no god's heaven -- just -- the horror! I've seen it -- life preying on life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie cowers in a corner, horrified by the transformatio sees in Indiana.  Shouting and pacing Indy holds his head the pain of his terrible thoughts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- rivers -- destroying mountains -- a comet in space -- exploding! (holding his head)   Aaahh! -- the screams -- pitiful people -- their pain -- the hate -- and greed -- always greed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light throws his shadow over Willie -- a giant shadow ing back and forth over her as she cries in the corner, u fight the evil devouring Indiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but I've found -- Kali's touch! Death -- no more lies -- the death I've been searching for! (shouting) Quit crying!  She can hear you -- Kali knows fear -- don't you under- stand -- Kali is freedom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana stops pacing and Willie freezes in terror.  Now a yellow light wipes across the room.  Indiana turns and wa silently as two Thuggee guards emerge from a secret doorw that's opened -- The shadows of the Thuggee guards loom over Willie and sh SCREAMS again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of frightening faces once again intones the horribl ficial chant.  Among the shorshippers, the little Maharaj on a riased platform.  Like the other believers, he stare the crevasse at the altar of Kali Ma. The wailing wind howls out of the high tunnel and the ter chanting reaches a fever pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once again the three sacred Sankara Stones glow magic Mola Ram materializes evilly amidst the swirling smoke an begins chanting in Sanskrit. Beside the altar, half-clad female acolytes pass in front robed priests -- with their fingers the women paint two w lines across the priests' foreheads. An acolyte moves in front of Chattar Lal -- the Prime Min now dressed in robes.  As the devotional markings are pai his forehead, Chattar Lal translates the High Priest's sp Indiana who stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mola Ram is telling the faithful of out victory.  He says the British have left the palace, which proves Kali Ma's new power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana bows his head to receive the mystical markings. tens to Mola Ram's rantings -- Indy's eyes are ominously as he stares up at the hideous statue of Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the temple, down in the bowels of the mountain, t ful children dig at the earth with their fingers.  A FAT slouches down the tunnel, flogging malingerers with a ale strap. Short Round sweats next to the others, clawing at the roc doomed to work with them now in their search for the last Sankara Stones. The leather strap suddenly flays Short Round's back and h manages not to scream out in pain.  The fat guard passes Round and the other kids pull a large rock which suddenly loose out of the wall -- ! They fall back and see they've exposed a vein of molten l Hearing their shouts, the fat guard returns -- yelling at stupidity, he whips them and shoves them aside brutally. Short Round see the fat guard's eyes glowing fiercely in Suddenly the fissure shoots out steam and spews some molt over the guard's legs. The guard screams and falls to the ground, thrashing abou ing to kick the searing lava off his smoking flesh. As the other kids cower, Short Round's humane instincts c to jump forward to help the guard who moments earlier was him -- Short Round tosses dirt on the guard's legs and grabs a g sack and starts rubbing the lava off.  Shorty notices som strange: The guard's eyes, which were glowing yellow before, are n ming and returning to normal.  The moaning guard looks at thankfully and then looks around as if waking from a nigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another slave kid) His eyes -- they go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other guards appear and lift the guard -- suddenly he sta struggling against the guards not wanting to return to th mare of Kali --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's dragged away) No!  NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pain -- the pain makes him wake up! (thinking quickly) Indy!  I can make Indy wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the other guards push and beat the children back to w Short Round is shoved against a wall and groans -- he rea and grabs a large rock, lifting it defiantly -- But rather than heaving it at the guard, Short Round smas rock down on the leg chains binding him to the other chil Shorty beats at the chain with the rock, determined to es

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind moans and joins Mola Ram's voice echoing maniaca the multitude gathered in the enormous temple.  On his th the little Maharajah listens transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chattar Lal watches Indiana staring hypnotically at the H Priest as he speaks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand what he tells us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kali Ma protects us now and for- ever, and we must pledge our devotion by worshipping her with an offering of flesh and blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly htere is a heart-rending scream of terror and th priests draf forward the next sacrificial victim -- Indiana's glowing eyes watch emotionlessly as Willie is b out. Dressed in a Rajput maiden's outfit, Willie has been ed and draped with flowers -- a strange contrast as she s desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend has seen and she has heard -- now she will not talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Willie is dragged past she sees Indy and calls to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy!  Help me!  Indy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie is shocked seeing that Indiana remains impassive a caring as she's dragged to her death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Indy) This will prove your devotion to Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana looks away from Willie's terrified face and stare adoringly at the monstrous statue of his goddess Kali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark tunnel, a rock smashes down onto a chain -- a breaks it!  Short Round is exhausted.  He looks around fu and sees a guard approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round takes a chance -- he dives and rolls across t tunnel.  He ducks behind a mine car full of rocks being p out by two chained children. The guard lumbers past unsuspectingly as Short Round make escape using the moving mine car as cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up in the temple, Willie continues to struggle as her leg strapped to the iron sacrifical frame.  Chattar Lal grabs hand and ties it down.  Willie's free hand reaches out im ly toward Indiana --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) Please, God, don't let them do this to me -- help me, Indy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out slowly and Willie grabs his hand tightly. looks into her eyes and then stares at her hand -- and sl lifts it and starts tying it to the iron frame. WILLIE (Cont'd) No -- no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie cries is disbelief as Indiana calmly betrays her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Round races up a tunnel and then flattens himself b corner.  He peers anxiously into a large carven and sees guards walking away. When the coast is clear, Short Round darts across the cav long wooden ladder tilted up against a wall.  Short Round up the high ladder and sees a kid with a sack of rocks de from a burrow-hole half-way up the wall. The exhausted kid nearly collapses at the bottom -- then seeing Short Round.  Shorty motions for him to keep quiet Amaxed, the kid watches Short Round scramble up the ladde Shorty continues until he is high above the floor. Dirty faces stare out of the high burrow as Short Round s climbing.  The kids are astonished as Short Round suddenl and kicks the ladder away from the wall! The high ladder falls in an arc and what seem like sure s slowly resembles a mini-Indiana Junes stunt as Short Roun to the other side of the falling ladder -- Short Round holds on for dear life as the ladder crashes the opposite cavern wall -- giving Short Round access to roof-hole that leads up to the temple!
